PCT/ENV/P05545/RE22102-CH2_LNG Tank Page 2-1 CHAPTER 2 PROJECT DESCRIPTION 2.1 PROJECT LOCATION 2.1.1 Selection of Project Location Gulf MTP LNG Terminal Company Limited (The Company) is an enterprise selected to invest in the Maptaphut Industrial Port Development Phase 3 Project. It has entered into the joint venture agreement in this project with the Industrial Estate Authority of Thailand (IEAT) on October 1st, 2019. Under the joint venture agreement, the company must build a port to transfer liquefied natural gas (LNG) from ship, store and processing thereof to supports the import of liquefied natural gas. Accordingly, the company plans to build the LNG storage and regasification station (The LNG Terminal Project) in the designated area of a 200 rai land plot at the Maptaphut Industrial Port Development Phase 3 Project, in Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate, Map Ta Phut Sub- district, Mueang Rayong District, Rayong Province (Figure 2.1-1). 2.1.2 Compliance with IEAT Land Use Zoning The LNG Terminal Project is located on a 200 rai land plot of Maptaphut Industrial Port Development Phase 3 Project. This development is aim to increase capabilities and capacity of loading natural gas and liquefied products in the petrochemical industry group in order to maintain the countryâ€™s energy security. The Project is promulgate by the Notification of the Board of Directors of the IEAT Regarding Changing of the General Industrial Zone, Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate (No. 7) published in the Government Gazette on 30 March 2020 to delineate the scope of industrial estate development (Appendix 2A). The project location comply with directive of the Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate and land use zoning of the Maptaphut Industrial Port Development Phase 3 Project. The Project also comply with the objectives of area extension of the Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate to support the Maptaphut Industrial Port Development Phase 3 Project and the growth of the industry sector, as stipulated in the Notification of the Notification of the Board of Directors of the IEAT Regarding Changing of the General Industrial Zone, Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate (No. 7) B.E. 2563. There are 6 utilization zoning areas, as shown in Figure 2.1-3 and Table 2.1-1. (1) Administration Area: the total area of 22.80 rai or 36,480 m2, about 11.40 % of the project area. The administration area accommodate the Administration Building, the Central Control Room, Gas Insulated Substation (GIS) Building, the Maintenance & Workshop, the Warehouse, the Fire Station, the LNG Hall &Canteen, the Guard House, and the Parking Area. (2) Process Area: the total area of 53.60 rai or 85,760 m2, about 26.80 percent of the project area. The process area accommodate seawater intake structure, seawater outfall structure, the boil-off gas (BOG) compressor, the vaporizer system, LNG truck loading, and the flare system, etc. In addition, the launching station of Natural Transmission Pipeline Project of Gulf MTP LNG Terminal Co., Ltd. is located at the process area as shown in Figure 2.1-4. (3) Utilities Area: the total area of 16.30 rai or 26,080 m2, about 8.15 % of the project area. The utilities area accommodate the utilities systems such as the Service Water Tank, the Wastewater Treatment System, Sub-station/Instrument Building, and Firewater Pump House, etc. (4) LNG Storage Tank Area: the total area of 76.70 rai or 122,720 m2, about 38.35 % of the project area. There are 4 LNG storage tanks in total. (5) Green Area: the total area of 12.10 rai or 19,360 m2, about 6.05 % of the project area. There is a green area within the administration area and the LNG storage tank area. (6) Temporary waste storage facility with a total area of 0.04 rai or 60 m2, about 0.02% of the total area. Executive Summary In this document, Gulf MTP LNG Terminal Company Limited (hereafter GMTP) outlines the information handover strategy for delivery of the digital asset. This strategy is based on mandatory use of "Capital Facilities Information Handover Specification" (CFIHOS) guidelines version V1.2 and leveraging Smart, Data Centric software to manage the data during the Project and facilitate the transition to Operations. Where definitions do not exist pragmatic definitions are used by GMTP with the intention of folding these definitions back into the CFIHOS standard. See the USPI-NL website for details: http://uspi-global.org/index.php/projects/frameworksmethodologies/136-cfihos Creation and Handover of high quality, accurate asset Information is business critical to GMTP for: ï¬ License to Operate ï¬ Reducing Operating, Maintenance, and Turnaround Costs ï¬ Reduction of Safety and Operational Risk ï¬ Enhancing Plant/Asset Availability and Reliability ï¬ Empowering Talent and Enabling Effective usage of Resources Provision of poor quality data during handover, whether incomplete, incorrect or in incompatible formats, will potentially delay "First Production" schedule, increase Project costs, and increase Operational costs going forward. Industry experience shows that handover costs, using traditional methods, can be as high as 6% to 8% of the Capital Project cost. The purpose of this document is to help reduce this to between 2% to 4% based on how much of this specification is adopted. This specification is based on the industry standard CFIHOS and is endorsed by many large companies such as Shell, Chevron, BP, Dow Chemical, INPEX and some EPCs. A standardized approach to project design and execution, through use of company mandated software which enforces pre-defined CFIHOS rules, will ensure data quality at all times. Deliverables will be continuously and checked against requirements, ensuring data integrity and contractual compliance while reducing labor intensity. This approach enables appointed EPCs to streamline activities through reuse of quality data across the design disciplines. It also supports timely handover of quality information to support Operational readiness and support future Operational strategies such as "Safe, Sustainable Engineering and Operational Excellence" going forward.
